name: Edge of the Bay Resort

reviews.text: This was the most expensive accommodation of our two weeks in Tasmania. We had just come from a beautiful cottage in Stewarts Bay (for considerably less) to Edge of the Bay. The cottage itself is adequate and clean, however it is very old. The whole cottage would shake when the wind picked up. We ate in the restaurant which was very nice. I was really annoyed by the attitude of one staff member. There was no explanation of what to do in the area or around the resort when we arrived. I was made to feel like I was wasting her time when I had to ask so many questions. We stayed four nights here and although we all loved the area and the amazing walks around Freycinet National Park, I'm sure I could find better accommodation next time.
reviews.title: A bit ordinary

reviews.text: The Edge of the Bay Resort classes itself as a resort. However it seemed to have two classes of accommodation - 5 star hotel suites and 3.5 star cottages. I can't rate the hotel suites but they looked new and classy.
reviews.title: Well positioned great features but suggest you research to ensure it will meet your requirements

reviews.text: When we booked in we looked at the glamorous website and booked into a cottage. It took us a day to come down from our expectation of a bit of glamour and tune into the comfortable feel. The cottage was fine: adequate kitchen, laundry, TV/in-house movies and DVD. Our cottage had two bedrooms one with bunks and the other queen bed. No soundproofing at all - walls are paper thin between the bedrooms. The standout were the wallabies that visited, the possums, the beach which was a 30 second walk from our cottage. The tennis court was first class (balls were not). No gym. Bikes for kids plentiful. Restaurant looked good but we ate in. The 'resort' is 10 minutes drive from the town. Ideally placed on the beach and makes for a pleasant walk to the main town - which is really a village. Cottage did not receive daily room service. Drinking water was collected from rain water tank - needed to be boiled. The resort (from a cottage perspective) felt more like a eco-resort. Note if you have Optus wireless dont expect any reception except in main cities in Tasmania.
reviews.title: Great views and location..pretty perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't add too much to the comments. Had dinner in the restaurant on New Year's Eve and it was very good. Great views from both the rooms and the restaurant. Rooms perfect - clean, comfortable, kitchenette was great for doing your own breakfast with a full size fridge, toaster and kettle although no cooking facilities.
reviews.title: Beautiful ocean suite with stunning views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only criticism - the music on their website and the website is not nearly as helpful as TripAdvisor for telling you what the facitlities are and what to expect.
reviews.title: Comfortable and modern with amazing views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very nice, the rooms are very spacious, the view is stunning, the food in the restaurant is good... but, however the hotel still a bit overpriced !
reviews.title: Wonderful location, very nice hotel, expensive too

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was okay: we used the tennis court, we used the bikes,...
reviews.title: Gorgeous views & lovely quiet rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One bad point may be that the blinds let the sun come in the bedroom from 5am in the morning! And as you are facing East, it's an early wake-up.
reviews.title: MOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A good place to go, the location makes the most of it, but nothing outstanding for $300 a night (with a $30 voucher for the restaurant included).
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think some of the early reviews are very harsh. We had a lovely relaxing stay and found all the staff very friendly and accommodating.
reviews.title: Beautiful location and a relaxing stay, just some minor niggles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night back in May arriving in the afternoon then walking the next morning over to Wineglass bay.
reviews.title: Great location, could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The options at the time for eating and accommodation all seemed ok but not great from our research before we left and this was our impression of Edge of the Bay. The room was ok and did have a lovely view but was not exactly luxurious. The sign about the sink demanding guests do their own washing up is not what I expect at $200+ per night. We ate in the restaurant and again the food was ok, not great, and the dining room was large and far from full and quite cold. Wine by the glass selection was very average. Breakfast was not offered unless a hamper was ordered which was disappointing for a resort in this price range. Surely a limited menu would not be difficult to offer?
reviews.title: Great Location.. Perhaps past its best but worth a closer look

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, if you need to choose somewhere to stay Edge of the Bay is clean and acceptable but don't expect it to be memorable. The access to Wineglass bay makes up for any accommodation disappointments though.
reviews.title: Nice and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a weekend trip away to Edge of the bay after reading reviews on trip advisor with a little trepidation. Most reviewers panned the service and the staff badly and we were pleased to find that perhaps they were staff hired for the busy summer season that have since been moved on as we found the staff to be friendly and well beyond our expectations having read other reviews! We stayed in one of the 2 bed “family” style cabins. Overall we found them to be functional and clean... fairly dated (15 year old appliances... Baltic pine panelling wall to wall and plenty of beige surfaces and the bathroom was the low light – tiny little shower), but you had to balance this with the tremendous view you got from the windows and decked area... and after all, you don't come to Freycinet for state of the art showering and a nice fridge. The food in the restaurant was decent, but too expensive for the standard offered. Overall we enjoyed our stay but the place felt a little unloved and there certainly weren't any special touches that would make it stand out – and there are many places delivering more for the same money these days... But 5 star location. Give this a look but for the right price.
reviews.title: Lovely but overpriced.

reviews.text: Edge of the Bay Resort is located in a good part of Coles Bay. Not too far from Freycinet National Park.
reviews.title: Nice view, and that's it
Secluded Luxury with an Uninterrupted View
reviews.text: A most beautiful and peaceful location. Modern luxury room with an uninterrupted view of Coles Bay and the Hazzards. Each room backing onto the beach.

My husband and I were travelling with friends around Tasmania from Sydney. Having stayed in the Henry Jones Art Hotel in Hobart for $270 per night that provided concierge welcoming, valet parking, lots of white fluffy towels, bathrobes, spa bath and lots of bathroom goodies, a kitchen and fridge full of drinks and goodies for us to enjoy, and a room with a view to kill we thought that another accommodation in the beautiful Freychinet area of a nightly tariff of $298 would give us something similar in quality.
reviews.title: Overcharge and disinterested staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because of the great location and one recommendation we stayed at Edge of the Bay Coles Bay. The staff on arrival were very matter of fact - no friendliness for an eco resort.
reviews.title: Outstanding Resort in sensational setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No information brochures available - they told us to go to the Visitors Information in town for brochures (most unimpressive).
reviews.title: The place in Tassie I most want to go back to!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Horrific brown coloured water except for cold tap in kitchen.
reviews.title: Very special place to stay and eat

aka: Edge Of The Bay Hotel Coles Bay
